fullDescription.text: If an HTML document contains two elements with the same id attribute, it may be interpreted differently by different browsers.

properties.name: Ambiguous HTML id attribute
properties.description:
If an HTML document contains two elements with the
              same id attribute, it may be interpreted differently
              by different browsers.

fullDescription.text: If the id of an HTML attribute is malformed, its interpretation may be browser-dependent.

properties.name: Malformed id attribute
properties.description:
If the id of an HTML attribute is malformed, its
              interpretation may be browser-dependent.

fullDescription.text: Specifying the same attribute twice on the same HTML element is redundant and may indicate a copy-paste mistake.

properties.name: Duplicate HTML element attributes
properties.description:
Specifying the same attribute twice on the same HTML element is
              redundant and may indicate a copy-paste mistake.

fullDescription.text: DOM functions that act like 'eval' and execute strings as code are dangerous and impede program analysis and understanding. Consequently, they should not be used.

properties.name: Call to eval-like DOM function
properties.description:
DOM functions that act like 'eval' and execute strings as code are dangerous and impede
              program analysis and understanding. Consequently, they should not be used.

fullDescription.text: External links that open in a new tab or window but do not specify link type 'noopener' or 'noreferrer' are a potential security risk.

properties.name: Potentially unsafe external link
properties.description:
External links that open in a new tab or window but do not specify
              link type 'noopener' or 'noreferrer' are a potential security risk.

fullDescription.text: Sanitizing an HTTP request parameter may be ineffective if the user controls its type.

properties.name: Type confusion through parameter tampering
properties.description: Sanitizing an HTTP request parameter may be ineffective if the user controls its type.

fullDescription.text: Matching a URL or hostname against a regular expression that contains an unescaped dot as part of the hostname might match more hostnames than expected.

properties.name: Incomplete regular expression for hostnames
properties.description: Matching a URL or hostname against a regular expression that contains an unescaped dot as part of the hostname might match more hostnames than expected.

fullDescription.text: Prepending a backslash to an ordinary character in a string does not have any effect, and may make regular expressions constructed from this string behave unexpectedly.

properties.name: Useless regular-expression character escape
properties.description:
Prepending a backslash to an ordinary character in a string
              does not have any effect, and may make regular expressions constructed from this string
              behave unexpectedly.

fullDescription.text: Using indexOf to implement endsWith functionality is error-prone if the -1 case is not explicitly handled.

properties.name: Incorrect suffix check
properties.description: Using indexOf to implement endsWith functionality is error-prone if the -1 case is not explicitly handled.

fullDescription.text: Checking for the "javascript:" URL scheme without also checking for "vbscript:" and "data:" suggests a logic error or even a security vulnerability.

properties.name: Incomplete URL scheme check
properties.description:
Checking for the "javascript:" URL scheme without also checking for "vbscript:"
              and "data:" suggests a logic error or even a security vulnerability.

fullDescription.text: Security checks on the substrings of an unparsed URL are often vulnerable to bypassing.

properties.name: Incomplete URL substring sanitization
properties.description: Security checks on the substrings of an unparsed URL are often vulnerable to bypassing.

fullDescription.text: Recursively merging a user-controlled object into another object can allow an attacker to modify the built-in Object prototype.

properties.name: Prototype pollution
properties.description:
Recursively merging a user-controlled object into another object
              can allow an attacker to modify the built-in Object prototype.

fullDescription.text: Recursively assigning properties on objects may cause accidental modification of a built-in prototype object.

properties.name: Prototype pollution in utility function
properties.description:
Recursively assigning properties on objects may cause
              accidental modification of a built-in prototype object.

shortDescription.text: Host header poisoning in email generation

fullDescription.text: Using the HTTP Host header to construct a link in an email can facilitate phishing attacks and leak password reset tokens.

properties.name: Host header poisoning in email generation
properties.description:
Using the HTTP Host header to construct a link in an email can facilitate phishing
              attacks and leak password reset tokens.

fullDescription.text: Using the `cat` process to read a file is unnecessarily complex, inefficient, unportable, and can lead to subtle bugs, or even security vulnerabilities.

properties.name: Unnecessary use of `cat` process
properties.description: Using the  `cat` process to read a file is unnecessarily complex, inefficient, unportable, and can lead to subtle bugs, or even security vulnerabilities.

shortDescription.text: Shell command built from environment values

fullDescription.text: Building a shell command string with values from the enclosing environment may cause subtle bugs or vulnerabilities.

properties.name: Shell command built from environment values
properties.description:
Building a shell command string with values from the enclosing
              environment may cause subtle bugs or vulnerabilities.

fullDescription.text: Using externally controlled strings in a command line may allow a malicious user to change the meaning of the command.

properties.name: Uncontrolled command line
properties.description:
Using externally controlled strings in a command line may allow a malicious
              user to change the meaning of the command.

fullDescription.text: Hard-coding credentials in source code may enable an attacker to gain unauthorized access.

properties.name: Hard-coded credentials
properties.description:
Hard-coding credentials in source code may enable an attacker
              to gain unauthorized access.

shortDescription.text: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic algorithm

fullDescription.text: Using broken or weak cryptographic algorithms can compromise security.

properties.name: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic algorithm
properties.description: Using broken or weak cryptographic algorithms can compromise security.

fullDescription.text: Using cookies without CSRF protection may allow malicious websites to submit requests on behalf of the user.

properties.name: Missing CSRF middleware
properties.description:
Using cookies without CSRF protection may allow malicious websites to
              submit requests on behalf of the user.

fullDescription.text: Parsing user input as an XML document with arbitrary internal entity expansion is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

properties.name: XML internal entity expansion
properties.description:
Parsing user input as an XML document with arbitrary internal
              entity expansion is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

fullDescription.text: An HTTP request handler that performs expensive operations without restricting the rate at which operations can be carried out is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

properties.name: Missing rate limiting
properties.description:
An HTTP request handler that performs expensive operations without
              restricting the rate at which operations can be carried out is vulnerable
              to denial-of-service attacks.

fullDescription.text: Client-side URL redirection based on unvalidated user input may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

properties.name: Client-side URL redirect
properties.description:
Client-side URL redirection based on unvalidated user input
              may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

fullDescription.text: Server-side URL redirection based on unvalidated user input may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

properties.name: Server-side URL redirect
properties.description:
Server-side URL redirection based on unvalidated user input
              may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

fullDescription.text: A string transformer that does not replace or escape all occurrences of a meta-character may be ineffective.

properties.name: Incomplete string escaping or encoding
properties.description:
A string transformer that does not replace or escape all occurrences of a
              meta-character may be ineffective.

fullDescription.text: When escaping special characters using a meta-character like backslash or ampersand, the meta-character has to be escaped first to avoid double-escaping, and conversely it has to be unescaped last to avoid double-unescaping.

properties.name: Double escaping or unescaping
properties.description:
When escaping special characters using a meta-character like backslash or
              ampersand, the meta-character has to be escaped first to avoid double-escaping,
              and conversely it has to be unescaped last to avoid double-unescaping.

fullDescription.text: Calling a method with a user-controlled name may dispatch to an unexpected target, which could cause an exception.

properties.name: Unvalidated dynamic method call
properties.description:
Calling a method with a user-controlled name may dispatch to
              an unexpected target, which could cause an exception.

fullDescription.text: Misconfiguration of CORS HTTP headers allows for leaks of secret credentials.

properties.name: CORS misconfiguration for credentials transfer
properties.description: Misconfiguration of CORS HTTP headers allows for leaks of secret credentials.

shortDescription.text: Information exposure through a stack trace

fullDescription.text: Propagating stack trace information to an external user can unintentionally reveal implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.

properties.name: Information exposure through a stack trace
properties.description:
Propagating stack trace information to an external user can
              unintentionally reveal implementation details that are useful
              to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.

shortDescription.text: Database query built from user-controlled sources

fullDescription.text: Building a database query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

properties.name: Database query built from user-controlled sources
properties.description:
Building a database query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of
              malicious code by the user.

shortDescription.text: Uncontrolled data used in path expression

fullDescription.text: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.

properties.name: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
properties.description:
Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access
              unexpected resources.

shortDescription.text: Arbitrary file write during zip extraction ("Zip Slip")

fullDescription.text: Extracting files from a malicious zip archive without validating that the destination file path is within the destination directory can cause files outside the destination directory to be overwritten.

properties.name: Arbitrary file write during zip extraction ("Zip Slip")
properties.description:
Extracting files from a malicious zip archive without validating that the
              destination file path is within the destination directory can cause files outside
              the destination directory to be overwritten.

fullDescription.text: Writing user input directly to an HTTP response allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

properties.name: Reflected cross-site scripting
properties.description:
Writing user input directly to an HTTP response allows for
              a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

fullDescription.text: A jQuery plugin that unintentionally constructs HTML from some of its options may be unsafe to use for clients.

properties.name: Unsafe jQuery plugin
properties.description: A jQuery plugin that unintentionally constructs HTML from some of its options may be unsafe to use for clients.

fullDescription.text: Using uncontrolled stored values in HTML allows for a stored cross-site scripting vulnerability.

properties.name: Stored cross-site scripting
properties.description:
Using uncontrolled stored values in HTML allows for
              a stored cross-site scripting vulnerability.

fullDescription.text: Writing user input directly to the DOM allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

properties.name: Client-side cross-site scripting
properties.description:
Writing user input directly to the DOM allows for
              a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

fullDescription.text: Using a cryptographically weak pseudo-random number generator to generate a security-sensitive value may allow an attacker to predict what value will be generated.

properties.name: Insecure randomness
properties.description:
Using a cryptographically weak pseudo-random number generator to generate a
              security-sensitive value may allow an attacker to predict what value will
              be generated.

fullDescription.text: Interpreting unsanitized user input as code allows a malicious user arbitrary code execution.

properties.name: Code injection
properties.description:
Interpreting unsanitized user input as code allows a malicious user arbitrary
              code execution.

fullDescription.text: Invoking user-controlled methods on certain objects can lead to remote code execution.

properties.name: Unsafe dynamic method access
properties.description: Invoking user-controlled methods on certain objects can lead to remote code execution.

shortDescription.text: Cross-window communication with unrestricted target origin

fullDescription.text: When sending sensitive information to another window using `postMessage`, the origin of the target window should be restricted to avoid unintentional information leaks.

properties.name: Cross-window communication with unrestricted target origin
properties.description:
When sending sensitive information to another window using `postMessage`,
              the origin of the target window should be restricted to avoid unintentional
              information leaks.

shortDescription.text: Use of password hash with insufficient computational effort

fullDescription.text: Creating a hash of a password with low computational effort makes the hash vulnerable to password cracking attacks.

properties.name: Use of password hash with insufficient computational effort
properties.description: Creating a hash of a password with low computational effort makes the hash vulnerable to password cracking attacks.

fullDescription.text: Parsing user input as an XML document with external entity expansion is vulnerable to XXE attacks.

properties.name: XML external entity expansion
properties.description:
Parsing user input as an XML document with external
              entity expansion is vulnerable to XXE attacks.

fullDescription.text: User input should not be used in regular expressions without first being escaped, otherwise a malicious user may be able to inject an expression that could require exponential time on certain inputs.

properties.name: Regular expression injection
properties.description:
User input should not be used in regular expressions without first being escaped,
              otherwise a malicious user may be able to inject an expression that could require
              exponential time on certain inputs.

fullDescription.text: Building an XPath expression from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

properties.name: XPath injection
properties.description:
Building an XPath expression from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of
              malicious code by the user.

shortDescription.text: Clear text storage of sensitive information

fullDescription.text: Sensitive information stored without encryption or hashing can expose it to an attacker.

properties.name: Clear text storage of sensitive information
properties.description:
Sensitive information stored without encryption or hashing can expose it to an
              attacker.

fullDescription.text: Logging sensitive information without encryption or hashing can expose it to an attacker.

properties.name: Clear-text logging of sensitive information
properties.description:
Logging sensitive information without encryption or hashing can
              expose it to an attacker.

fullDescription.text: Deserializing user-controlled data may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code.

properties.name: Deserialization of user-controlled data
properties.description:
Deserializing user-controlled data may allow attackers to
              execute arbitrary code.

fullDescription.text: Iterating over an object with a user-controlled .length property can cause indefinite looping.

properties.name: Loop bound injection
properties.description:
Iterating over an object with a user-controlled .length
              property can cause indefinite looping.

fullDescription.text: Using external input in format strings can lead to garbled output.

properties.name: Use of externally-controlled format string
properties.description: Using external input in format strings can lead to garbled output.

fullDescription.text: Functions without explicit dependency injections will not work when their parameter names are minified.

properties.name: Missing explicit dependency injection
properties.description:
Functions without explicit dependency injections
                will not work when their parameter names are minified.

fullDescription.text: Recompiling an already compiled part of the DOM can lead to unexpected behavior of directives, performance problems, and memory leaks.

properties.name: Double compilation
properties.description:
Recompiling an already compiled part of the DOM can lead to
              unexpected behavior of directives, performance problems, and memory leaks.

fullDescription.text: Repeated dependency names are redundant for AngularJS dependency injection.

properties.name: Duplicate dependency
properties.description: Repeated dependency names are redundant for AngularJS dependency injection.

fullDescription.text: Dependency-injecting a service of the wrong kind causes an error at runtime.

properties.name: Incompatible dependency injection
properties.description: Dependency-injecting a service of the wrong kind causes an error at runtime.

fullDescription.text: Disabling strict contextual escaping (SCE) can cause security vulnerabilities.

properties.name: Disabling SCE
properties.description: Disabling strict contextual escaping (SCE) can cause security vulnerabilities.

fullDescription.text: If the injected dependencies of a function go out of sync with its parameters, the function will become difficult to understand and maintain.

properties.name: Dependency mismatch
properties.description:
If the injected dependencies of a function go out of sync
              with its parameters, the function will become difficult to
              understand and maintain.

shortDescription.text: Use of AngularJS markup in URL-valued attribute

fullDescription.text: Using AngularJS markup in an HTML attribute that references a URL (such as 'href' or 'src') may cause the browser to send a request with an invalid URL.

properties.name: Use of AngularJS markup in URL-valued attribute
properties.description:
Using AngularJS markup in an HTML attribute that references a URL
              (such as 'href' or 'src') may cause the browser to send a request
              with an invalid URL.

fullDescription.text: Specifying dependency injections of an AngularJS component multiple times overrides earlier specifications.

properties.name: Repeated dependency injection
properties.description: Specifying dependency injections of an AngularJS component multiple times overrides earlier specifications.

fullDescription.text: URL whitelists that are too permissive can cause security vulnerabilities.

properties.name: Insecure URL whitelist
properties.description: URL whitelists that are too permissive can cause security vulnerabilities.

fullDescription.text: An arrow method on a Vue instance doesn't have its `this` variable bound to the Vue instance.

properties.name: Arrow method on Vue instance
properties.description: An arrow method on a Vue instance doesn't have its `this` variable bound to the Vue instance.

fullDescription.text: Updating the state of a component based on the current value of 'this.state' or 'this.props' may lead to inconsistent component state.

properties.name: Potentially inconsistent state update
properties.description:
Updating the state of a component based on the current value of
              'this.state' or 'this.props' may lead to inconsistent component
              state.

shortDescription.text: Unsupported state update in lifecycle method

fullDescription.text: Attempting to update the state of a React component at the wrong time can cause undesired behavior.

properties.name: Unsupported state update in lifecycle method
properties.description: Attempting to update the state of a React component at the wrong time can cause undesired behavior.

fullDescription.text: Mutating the state of a React component directly may lead to lost updates.

properties.name: Direct state mutation
properties.description:
Mutating the state of a React component directly may lead to
              lost updates.

fullDescription.text: Unused or undefined component state properties may be a symptom of a bug and should be examined carefully.

properties.name: Unused or undefined state property
properties.description: Unused or undefined component state properties may be a symptom of a bug and should be examined carefully.

fullDescription.text: Disabling webSecurity can cause critical security vulnerabilities.

properties.name: Disabling Electron webSecurity
properties.description: Disabling webSecurity can cause critical security vulnerabilities.

fullDescription.text: Enabling allowRunningInsecureContent can allow remote code execution.

properties.name: Enabling Electron allowRunningInsecureContent
properties.description: Enabling allowRunningInsecureContent can allow remote code execution.

fullDescription.text: A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

properties.name: Inefficient regular expression
properties.description:
A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs
              can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service
              attacks.

shortDescription.text: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data

fullDescription.text: A regular expression that can require polynomial time to match user-provided values may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

properties.name: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data
properties.description:
A regular expression that can require polynomial time
              to match user-provided values may be
              vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

fullDescription.text: If a dollar assertion '$' appears in a regular expression before another term that cannot match the empty string, then this assertion can never match, so the entire regular expression cannot match any string.

properties.name: Unmatchable dollar in regular expression
properties.description:
If a dollar assertion '$' appears in a regular expression before another term that
              cannot match the empty string, then this assertion can never match, so the entire
              regular expression cannot match any string.

fullDescription.text: If a caret assertion '^' appears in a regular expression after another term that cannot match the empty string, then this assertion can never match, so the entire regular expression cannot match any string.

properties.name: Unmatchable caret in regular expression
properties.description:
If a caret assertion '^' appears in a regular expression after another term that
              cannot match the empty string, then this assertion can never match, so the entire
              regular expression cannot match any string.

fullDescription.text: Empty character classes are not normally useful and may indicate a bug.

properties.name: Empty character class
properties.description: Empty character classes are not normally useful and may indicate a bug.

fullDescription.text: Regular expression tests that always find a match indicate dead code or a logic error

properties.name: Regular expression always matches
properties.description: Regular expression tests that always find a match indicate dead code or a logic error

fullDescription.text: If a character class in a regular expression contains the same character twice, this may indicate a bug.

properties.name: Duplicate character in character class
properties.description:
If a character class in a regular expression contains the same character twice, this may
              indicate a bug.

shortDescription.text: Replacement of a substring with itself

fullDescription.text: Replacing a substring with itself has no effect and may indicate a mistake.

properties.name: Replacement of a substring with itself
properties.description: Replacing a substring with itself has no effect and may indicate a mistake.

fullDescription.text: Regular expression escape sequences of the form '\n', where 'n' is a positive number greater than the number of capture groups in the regular expression, are not allowed by the ECMAScript standard.

properties.name: Unbound back reference
properties.description:
Regular expression escape sequences of the form '\n', where 'n' is a positive number
              greater than the number of capture groups in the regular expression, are not allowed
              by the ECMAScript standard.

shortDescription.text: Back reference into negative lookahead assertion

fullDescription.text: If a back reference refers to a capture group inside a preceding negative lookahead assertion, then the back reference always matches the empty string, which probably indicates a mistake.

properties.name: Back reference into negative lookahead assertion
properties.description:
If a back reference refers to a capture group inside a preceding negative lookahead assertion,
              then the back reference always matches the empty string, which probably indicates a mistake.

fullDescription.text: If a back reference precedes the capture group it refers to, it matches the empty string, which is probably not what was expected.

properties.name: Back reference precedes capture group
properties.description:
If a back reference precedes the capture group it refers to, it matches the empty string,
              which is probably not what was expected.

fullDescription.text: The special 'arguments' variable can be redefined, but this should be avoided since it makes code hard to read and maintain and may prevent compiler optimizations.

properties.name: Arguments redefined
properties.description:
The special 'arguments' variable can be redefined, but this should be avoided
              since it makes code hard to read and maintain and may prevent compiler
              optimizations.

fullDescription.text: If a variable is not declared as a local variable, it becomes a global variable by default, which may be unintentional and could lead to unexpected behavior.

properties.name: Missing variable declaration
properties.description:
If a variable is not declared as a local variable, it becomes a global variable
              by default, which may be unintentional and could lead to unexpected behavior.

fullDescription.text: An assignment to a property whose value is always overwritten has no effect.

properties.name: Useless assignment to property
properties.description: An assignment to a property whose value is always overwritten has no effect.

shortDescription.text: Wrong use of 'this' for static method

fullDescription.text: A reference to a static method from within an instance method needs to be qualified with the class name, not `this`.

properties.name: Wrong use of 'this' for static method
properties.description: A reference to a static method from within an instance method needs to be qualified with the class name, not `this`.

fullDescription.text: If an object literal has two properties with the same name, the second property overwrites the first one, which makes the code hard to understand and error-prone.

properties.name: Overwritten property
properties.description:
If an object literal has two properties with the same name,
              the second property overwrites the first one,
              which makes the code hard to understand and error-prone.

fullDescription.text: A method declaration with a name that is a special keyword in another context is suspicious.

properties.name: Suspicious method name declaration
properties.description:
A method declaration with a name that is a special keyword in another
              context is suspicious.

fullDescription.text: If a variable is declared and initialized twice inside the same variable declaration statement, the second initialization immediately overwrites the first one.

properties.name: Conflicting variable initialization
properties.description:
If a variable is declared and initialized twice inside the same variable declaration
              statement, the second initialization immediately overwrites the first one.

shortDescription.text: Unused variable, import, function or class

fullDescription.text: Unused variables, imports, functions or classes may be a symptom of a bug and should be examined carefully.

properties.name: Unused variable, import, function or class
properties.description:
Unused variables, imports, functions or classes may be a symptom of a bug
              and should be examined carefully.

fullDescription.text: If two functions with the same name are declared in the same scope, one of the declarations overrides the other without warning. This makes the code hard to read and maintain, and may even lead to platform-dependent behavior.

properties.name: Conflicting function declarations
properties.description:
If two functions with the same name are declared in the same scope, one of the declarations
              overrides the other without warning. This makes the code hard to read and maintain, and
              may even lead to platform-dependent behavior.

fullDescription.text: Variables should be declared before their first use.

properties.name: Variable not declared before use
properties.description: Variables should be declared before their first use.

fullDescription.text: Having multiple overloads with the same parameter types in TypeScript makes all overloads except the first one unreachable, as the compiler always resolves calls to the textually first matching overload.

properties.name: Unreachable method overloads
properties.description:
Having multiple overloads with the same parameter types in TypeScript
              makes all overloads except the first one unreachable, as the compiler
              always resolves calls to the textually first matching overload.

fullDescription.text: Referencing an undeclared global variable in a class that has a member of the same name is confusing and may indicate a bug.

properties.name: Missing 'this' qualifier
properties.description: Referencing an undeclared global variable in a class that has a member of the same name is confusing and may indicate a bug.

fullDescription.text: A variable declaration statement that declares the same variable twice is confusing and hard to maintain.

properties.name: Duplicate variable declaration
properties.description:
A variable declaration statement that declares the same variable twice is
              confusing and hard to maintain.

fullDescription.text: Assigning to a variable that is declared 'const' has either no effect or leads to a runtime error, depending on the platform.

properties.name: Assignment to constant
properties.description:
Assigning to a variable that is declared 'const' has either no effect or leads to a
              runtime error, depending on the platform.

fullDescription.text: If a default parameter value references a function that is nested inside the function to which the parameter belongs, a runtime error will occur, since the function is not yet defined at the point where it is referenced.

properties.name: Default parameter references nested function
properties.description:
If a default parameter value references a function that is nested inside the
              function to which the parameter belongs, a runtime error will occur, since
              the function is not yet defined at the point where it is referenced.

fullDescription.text: An assignment to a local variable that is not used later on, or whose value is always overwritten, has no effect.

properties.name: Useless assignment to local variable
properties.description:
An assignment to a local variable that is not used later on, or whose value is always
              overwritten, has no effect.

fullDescription.text: If a function has two parameters with the same name, the second parameter shadows the first one, which makes the code hard to understand and error-prone.

properties.name: Duplicate parameter names
properties.description:
If a function has two parameters with the same name, the second parameter
              shadows the first one, which makes the code hard to understand and error-prone.

fullDescription.text: Omitting the name of a parameter causes its type annotation to be parsed as the name.

properties.name: Ineffective parameter type
properties.description: Omitting the name of a parameter causes its type annotation to be parsed as the name.

shortDescription.text: Access to let-bound variable in temporal dead zone

fullDescription.text: Accessing a let-bound variable before its declaration will lead to a runtime error on ECMAScript 2015-compatible platforms.

properties.name: Access to let-bound variable in temporal dead zone
properties.description:
Accessing a let-bound variable before its declaration will lead to a runtime
              error on ECMAScript 2015-compatible platforms.

fullDescription.text: Assigning to the special 'exports' variable only overwrites its value and does not export anything. Such an assignment is hence most likely unintentional.

properties.name: Assignment to exports variable
properties.description:
Assigning to the special 'exports' variable only overwrites its value and does not export
              anything. Such an assignment is hence most likely unintentional.

fullDescription.text: Referencing an undeclared global variable in a module that exports a definition of the same name is confusing and may indicate a bug.

properties.name: Missing exports qualifier
properties.description:
Referencing an undeclared global variable in a module that exports
              a definition of the same name is confusing and may indicate a bug.

fullDescription.text: Defensive code that guards against a situation that never happens is not needed.

properties.name: Unneeded defensive code
properties.description: Defensive code that guards against a situation that never happens is not needed.

fullDescription.text: An expression that has no effect and is used in a void context is most likely redundant and may indicate a bug.

properties.name: Expression has no effect
properties.description:
An expression that has no effect and is used in a void context is most
              likely redundant and may indicate a bug.

fullDescription.text: Misspelling a variable name implicitly introduces a global variable, which may not lead to a runtime error, but is likely to give wrong results.

properties.name: Misspelled variable name
properties.description:
Misspelling a variable name implicitly introduces a global
              variable, which may not lead to a runtime error, but is
              likely to give wrong results.

fullDescription.text: Invoking an event handler method as a function can cause a runtime error.

properties.name: Unbound event handler receiver
properties.description: Invoking an event handler method as a function can cause a runtime error.

fullDescription.text: Nested expressions where the formatting contradicts the grouping enforced by operator precedence are difficult to read and may even indicate a bug.

properties.name: Whitespace contradicts operator precedence
properties.description:
Nested expressions where the formatting contradicts the grouping enforced by operator precedence
              are difficult to read and may even indicate a bug.

fullDescription.text: Passing identical, or seemingly identical, operands to an operator such as subtraction or conjunction may indicate a typo; even if it is intentional, it makes the code hard to read.

properties.name: Identical operands

fullDescription.text: Two variables are being compared using a relational operator, but one is also used to index into the other, suggesting a ".length" is missing from the comparison.

properties.name: Missing '.length' in comparison
properties.description:
Two variables are being compared using a relational operator, but one is also used
             to index into the other, suggesting a ".length" is missing from the comparison.

fullDescription.text: Trying to invoke a value that is not a function will result in a runtime exception.

properties.name: Invocation of non-function
properties.description:
Trying to invoke a value that is not a function will result
              in a runtime exception.

fullDescription.text: Using a promise without awaiting its result can lead to unexpected behavior.

properties.name: Missing await
properties.description: Using a promise without awaiting its result can lead to unexpected behavior.

fullDescription.text: Listing the same property twice in one object literal is redundant and may indicate a copy-paste mistake.

properties.name: Duplicate property
properties.description:
Listing the same property twice in one object literal is
              redundant and may indicate a copy-paste mistake.

fullDescription.text: Calling 'String.prototype.replace' or 'String.prototype.split' with a string argument that looks like a regular expression is probably a mistake because the called function will not convert the string into a regular expression.

properties.name: String instead of regular expression
properties.description: Calling 'String.prototype.replace' or 'String.prototype.split' with a string argument that looks like a regular expression is probably a mistake because the called function will not convert the string into a regular expression.

shortDescription.text: Property access on null or undefined

fullDescription.text: Trying to access a property of "null" or "undefined" will result in a runtime exception.

properties.name: Property access on null or undefined
properties.description:
Trying to access a property of "null" or "undefined" will result
              in a runtime exception.

fullDescription.text: The integer shift operators '<<', '>>' and '>>>' only take the five least significant bits of their right operand into account. Thus, it is not possible to shift an integer by more than 31 bits.

properties.name: Shift out of range
properties.description:
The integer shift operators '<<', '>>' and '>>>' only take the five least significant bits of their
              right operand into account. Thus, it is not possible to shift an integer by more than 31 bits.

fullDescription.text: Joining constant strings into a longer string where two words are concatenated without a separating space usually indicates a text error.

properties.name: Missing space in string concatenation
properties.description:
Joining constant strings into a longer string where
              two words are concatenated without a separating space
              usually indicates a text error.

fullDescription.text: If two conditions in an 'if'-'else if' chain are identical, the second condition will never hold.

properties.name: Duplicate 'if' condition
properties.description:
If two conditions in an 'if'-'else if' chain are identical, the
              second condition will never hold.

fullDescription.text: An equality comparison between two values that cannot be meaningfully converted to the same type will always yield 'false', and an inequality comparison will always yield 'true'.

properties.name: Comparison between inconvertible types
properties.description:
An equality comparison between two values that cannot be meaningfully converted to
              the same type will always yield 'false', and an inequality comparison will always
              yield 'true'.

fullDescription.text: Nested expressions involving binary bitwise operators and comparisons are easy to misunderstand without additional disambiguating parentheses or whitespace.

properties.name: Unclear precedence of nested operators
properties.description:
Nested expressions involving binary bitwise operators and comparisons are easy
              to misunderstand without additional disambiguating parentheses or whitespace.

fullDescription.text: Assigning a variable to itself has no effect.

properties.name: Self assignment
properties.description: Assigning a variable to itself has no effect.

fullDescription.text: If two cases in a switch statement have the same label, the second case will never be executed.

properties.name: Duplicate switch case
properties.description:
If two cases in a switch statement have the same label, the second case
              will never be executed.

fullDescription.text: An unknown directive has no effect and may indicate a misspelling.

properties.name: Unknown directive
properties.description: An unknown directive has no effect and may indicate a misspelling.

fullDescription.text: Arithmetic comparisons with NaN are useless: nothing is considered to be equal to NaN, not even NaN itself, and similarly nothing is considered greater or less than NaN.

properties.name: Comparison with NaN
properties.description:
Arithmetic comparisons with NaN are useless: nothing is considered to be equal to NaN, not even NaN itself,
              and similarly nothing is considered greater or less than NaN.

fullDescription.text: Relying on implicit conversion of operands is error-prone and makes code hard to read.

properties.name: Implicit operand conversion
properties.description:
Relying on implicit conversion of operands is error-prone and makes code
              hard to read.

fullDescription.text: If a conditional expression always evaluates to true or always evaluates to false, this suggests incomplete code or a logic error.

properties.name: Useless conditional
properties.description:
If a conditional expression always evaluates to true or always
              evaluates to false, this suggests incomplete code or a logic
              error.

fullDescription.text: The 'else' clause of an 'if' statement should be aligned with the 'if' it belongs to.

properties.name: Misleading indentation of dangling 'else'
properties.description: The 'else' clause of an 'if' statement should be aligned with the 'if' it belongs to.

fullDescription.text: A non-case label appearing in a switch statement that is textually aligned with a case label is confusing to read, or may even indicate a bug.

properties.name: Non-case label in switch statement
properties.description:
A non-case label appearing in a switch statement that is textually aligned with a case
              label is confusing to read, or may even indicate a bug.

fullDescription.text: A comparison that always evaluates to true or always evaluates to false may indicate faulty logic and dead code.

properties.name: Useless comparison test
properties.description:
A comparison that always evaluates to true or always evaluates to false may
              indicate faulty logic and dead code.

fullDescription.text: Unreachable statements are often indicative of missing code or latent bugs and should be avoided.

properties.name: Unreachable statement
properties.description: Unreachable statements are often indicative of missing code or latent bugs and should be avoided.

shortDescription.text: Ignoring result from pure array method

fullDescription.text: Ignoring the result of an array method that does not modify its receiver is generally an error.

properties.name: Ignoring result from pure array method
properties.description: Ignoring the result of an array method that does not modify its receiver is generally an error.

fullDescription.text: Using the return value of a function that does not return an expression is indicative of a mistake.

properties.name: Use of returnless function
properties.description: Using the return value of a function that does not return an expression is indicative of a mistake.

fullDescription.text: An assignment to a local variable in a return statement is useless, since the variable will immediately go out of scope and its value is lost.

properties.name: Return statement assigns local variable
properties.description:
An assignment to a local variable in a return statement is useless, since the variable will
              immediately go out of scope and its value is lost.

fullDescription.text: A 'for' loop that increments its loop variable but checks it against a lower bound, or decrements its loop variable but checks it against an upper bound, will either stop iterating immediately or keep iterating indefinitely, and is usually indicative of a typo.

properties.name: Inconsistent direction of for loop
properties.description:
A 'for' loop that increments its loop variable but checks it
              against a lower bound, or decrements its loop variable but
              checks it against an upper bound, will either stop iterating
              immediately or keep iterating indefinitely, and is usually
              indicative of a typo.

fullDescription.text: The body of a control statement should have appropriate indentation to clarify which statements it controls and which ones it does not control.

properties.name: Misleading indentation after control statement
properties.description:
The body of a control statement should have appropriate indentation to clarify which
              statements it controls and which ones it does not control.

shortDescription.text: Loop iteration skipped due to shifting

fullDescription.text: Removing elements from an array while iterating over it can cause the loop to skip over some elements, unless the loop index is decremented accordingly.

properties.name: Loop iteration skipped due to shifting
properties.description:
Removing elements from an array while iterating over it can cause the loop to skip over some elements,
              unless the loop index is decremented accordingly.

fullDescription.text: A loop iteration variable is unused, which suggests an error.

properties.name: Unused loop iteration variable
properties.description: A loop iteration variable is unused, which suggests an error.

fullDescription.text: A function is invoked with extra trailing arguments that are ignored.

properties.name: Superfluous trailing arguments
properties.description: A function is invoked with extra trailing arguments that are ignored.

fullDescription.text: Code that uses automatic semicolon insertion inconsistently is hard to read and maintain.

properties.name: Semicolon insertion
properties.description: Code that uses automatic semicolon insertion inconsistently is hard to read and maintain.

fullDescription.text: Iterating over an array but not using the index variable to access array elements may indicate a typo or logic error.

properties.name: Unused index variable
properties.description:
Iterating over an array but not using the index variable to access array elements
              may indicate a typo or logic error.

fullDescription.text: A string literal appears to use template syntax but is not quoted with backticks.

properties.name: Template syntax in string literal
properties.description: A string literal appears to use template syntax but is not quoted with backticks.

fullDescription.text: 'for'-'in' comprehension blocks are a Mozilla-specific language extension that is no longer supported.

properties.name: Use of for-in comprehension blocks
properties.description:
'for'-'in' comprehension blocks are a Mozilla-specific language extension
              that is no longer supported.

fullDescription.text: Non-standard language features such as expression closures or let expressions make it harder to reuse code.

properties.name: Use of platform-specific language features
properties.description:
Non-standard language features such as expression closures or let expressions
              make it harder to reuse code.

fullDescription.text: An array index is compared to be less than or equal to the 'length' property, and then used in an indexing operation that could be out of bounds.

properties.name: Off-by-one comparison against length
properties.description:
An array index is compared to be less than or equal to the 'length' property,
              and then used in an indexing operation that could be out of bounds.

shortDescription.text: Use of call stack introspection in strict mode

fullDescription.text: Accessing properties 'arguments.caller', 'arguments.callee', 'Function.prototype.caller' or 'Function.prototype.arguments' in strict mode will cause a runtime error.

properties.name: Use of call stack introspection in strict mode
properties.description:
Accessing properties 'arguments.caller', 'arguments.callee',
              'Function.prototype.caller' or 'Function.prototype.arguments'
              in strict mode will cause a runtime error.

fullDescription.text: An attempt to use a value that is not an object or 'null' as a prototype will either be ignored or result in a runtime error.

properties.name: Invalid prototype value
properties.description:
An attempt to use a value that is not an object or 'null' as a
              prototype will either be ignored or result in a runtime error.

fullDescription.text: Comparing the result of a typeof test against a string other than 'undefined', 'boolean', 'number', 'string', 'object', 'function' or 'symbol' is useless, since this comparison can never succeed.

properties.name: Useless type test
properties.description:
Comparing the result of a typeof test against a string other than 'undefined',
              'boolean', 'number', 'string', 'object', 'function' or 'symbol' is useless, since
              this comparison can never succeed.

shortDescription.text: Assignment to property of primitive value

fullDescription.text: Assigning to a property of a primitive value has no effect and may trigger a runtime error.

properties.name: Assignment to property of primitive value
properties.description:
Assigning to a property of a primitive value has no effect
              and may trigger a runtime error.

fullDescription.text: The 'with' statement has subtle semantics and should not be used.

properties.name: With statement
properties.description: The 'with' statement has subtle semantics and should not be used.

fullDescription.text: Conditional comments are an IE-specific feature and not portable.

properties.name: Conditional comments
properties.description: Conditional comments are an IE-specific feature and not portable.

fullDescription.text: Returning a value from a setter function is useless, since it will always be ignored.

properties.name: Useless return in setter
properties.description:
Returning a value from a setter function is useless, since it will
              always be ignored.

fullDescription.text: If the same pattern variable appears twice in an array or object pattern, the second binding will silently overwrite the first binding, which is probably unintentional.

properties.name: Non-linear pattern
properties.description:
If the same pattern variable appears twice in an array or object pattern,
              the second binding will silently overwrite the first binding, which is probably
              unintentional.

fullDescription.text: A piece of code could not be parsed due to syntax errors.

properties.name: Syntax error
properties.description: A piece of code could not be parsed due to syntax errors.

fullDescription.text: Attempting to invoke a method or an arrow function using 'new', or invoking a constructor as a function, will cause a runtime error.

properties.name: Illegal invocation
properties.description:
Attempting to invoke a method or an arrow function using 'new',
              or invoking a constructor as a function, will cause a runtime
              error.

fullDescription.text: Accessing 'this' or a property of 'super' in the constructor of a subclass before calling the super constructor will cause a runtime error.

properties.name: Use of incompletely initialized object
properties.description:
Accessing 'this' or a property of 'super' in the constructor of a
              subclass before calling the super constructor will cause a runtime error.

fullDescription.text: The operand of the 'delete' operator should always be a property accessor.

properties.name: Deleting non-property
properties.description: The operand of the 'delete' operator should always be a property accessor.

fullDescription.text: 'yield' should only be used in generator functions.

properties.name: Yield in non-generator function
properties.description: 'yield' should only be used in generator functions.

fullDescription.text: If a function is intended to be a constructor, it should always be invoked with 'new'. Otherwise, it should always be invoked as a normal function, that is, without 'new'.

properties.name: Inconsistent use of 'new'
properties.description:
If a function is intended to be a constructor, it should always
              be invoked with 'new'. Otherwise, it should always be invoked
              as a normal function, that is, without 'new'.

message.text: The initial value of m is unused, since it is always overwritten.
